entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 180 to 240 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 35 mm/h expected. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 220 to 280 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 35 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a total of 200 to 250 mm of rain, especially about the higher ground. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected Wednesday morning, afternoon and evening. Note that there is a low risk of localised downpours bringing rainfall intensities of 25 to 40 mm/h from Wednesday afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate. Changes: Warning period extended to Thursday morning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. If warning amounts of rain do accumulate they are most likely from late Wednesday morning. Also note there is a risk of downpours bringing hourly rainfall intensities of 25 to 40 mm about Great Barrier Island and Auckland north of the Harbour Bridge from Wednesday afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: High. Changes: Note that the chance of upgrade to an Orange Warning for Great Barrier Island and areas north of the Harbour Bridge is high but moderate elsewhere.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: In the 12 hours from 9am to 9pm today expect 60 to 80 mm of rain. Downpours of 25 to 40 mm per hour are possible, especially in the north and east. The downpours may occur with or without thunderstorms. In the 24 hours from 1am Wednesday to 1 am Thursday expect a further 120 to 160 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h at times. Downpours of 25 to 40 mm per hour are again possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate. Changes: Another period of heavy rain added for Wednesday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
